Albeit you experienced pregnancy and labor before, you now have added more responsibilities and considerations to get ready for your second baby. Firstly try to help your first child to understand what to expect, and make him aware of the changes that are going to happen with the birth of a younger brother or sister. However, bringing up two children can be a bit too much at first, your time will be restricted, and youâ€™ll be busier. Donâ€™t be surprised if during your second pregnancy you may be more exhausted than during the first one, as tacking care for your older child when pregnant usually takes a lot of time and energy. The first six to eight weeks after the birth can be the most demanding, as your main job will be trying to get your second baby on a feeding and sleeping schedule, and at the same time actively anticipating your older child\'s needs and changing emotions. There are as well few positive changes, with the birth and nursing of the second child you will acquire confidence in your own abilities, knowledge, and experience, moreover, stuff that seemed so hard with your first child, like breastfeeding, changing diapers, handling illness will be much easier this time. Nevertheless, you should clearly understand that bringing home a new baby will affect you physically and emotionally. Increased exhaustion and soft Anxiety will be your normal condition after having the second baby.
